title: Konar quo Maten

properties.name: description
properties.value: Konar quo Maten (translated as Konar the Hunter) is a slayer master who is found in the Kahlith settlement on the summit of Mount Karuulm. Players must have a combat level of at least 75 to be assigned a Slayer task from her.

content:
Konar quo Maten
Released10 January 2019 (Update)
MembersYes
RaceKahlith
LocationMount Karuulm
Sells itemsSlayer Equipment

ExamineShe looks dangerous, and slightly crazy!

Advanced data
NPC ID8623

Konar quo Maten (translated as Konar the Hunter) is a slayer master who is found in the Kahlith settlement on the summit of Mount Karuulm. Players must have a combat level of at least 75 to be assigned a Slayer task from her.

The quickest way to reach her is via Rada's blessing 3 or 4's teleport, which would take the player right atop of Mount Karuulm. Players who haven't completed the hard or elite Kourend & Kebos Diaries can easily reach her by heading north of either the CIR fairy ring, the Farming Guild teleport (found on the Skills necklace/Farming cape) or the Battlefront teleport.

Konar is initially unavailable in the NPC Contact spell and must be spoken to first, before becoming an option. The right-click "Assignment" option will not unlock her in NPC contact.

Contents

  • 1 Slayer points
  • 2 Tasks
  • 3 Dialogue
  • 4 Gallery
  • 5 Changes
  • 6 References

Slayer points[edit | edit source]

Players can receive slayer reward points for completing Slayer tasksâ€”this is based on how many tasks players have accomplished in a row. Completion of a task assigned by Konar will grant you a varying amount of points, depending if players have completed the Kourend & Kebos Diary. Although she is the third highest slayer master, she gives the second highest slayer point reward per task due to requiring players to slay in a specific area. This is only beaten by Krystilia who gives slayer tasks in the Wilderness.

Task interval Points given
Default Elite Diary
Every task 18 20
Every 10th 90 100
Every 50th 270 300
Every 100th 450 500
Every 250th 630 700
Every 1,000th 900 1,000

Tasks[edit | edit source]

Unlike other slayer masters, Konar's Slayer tasks also include a specific location where you must complete the entire task. For example, if Konar assigns the player an Abyssal demon task, she will direct the player to slay them in either the Slayer Tower, the Catacombs of Kourend or the Abyssal Area for the entire task. Bosses count towards task progression should the substitute be in the same area as the assigned monster (e.g if the player is assigned to kill black demons in the Catacombs of Kourend, killing Skotizo will count towards the task).

She will not send players to the Wilderness apart from boss slayer, as Krystilia is the one who specialises at this.

In return for killing the assigned monsters at the location Konar specifies, players have a chance of receiving a Brimstone key, which can be used to open the Brimstone chest next to her.

Lastly, while the Slayer cape perk gives a 10% chance to be reassigned the same monster for a player's task, the location she asks you to slay them can be different from the last task.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
28 February 2019
(update)
  • Konar will no longer assign Black, Red, Blue or Green dragons within the Kourend Catacombs if the player has under 100 combat
  • Konar will no longer assign Fire giants in the Waterfall Dungeon to players who haven't yet completed the Waterfall Quest
7 February 2019
(update | poll)

Loot from Konar's drop table are replaced by brimstone keys; the loot has now been moved to the brimstone chest which the key accesses.

21 January 2019
(update) 		Hotfix

Konar's drop table was re-tweaked, removing adamant and runite bolts and reintroducing dragon dart tips and magic logs, a bug resulting in noted drops being received in unnoted form was fixed.[2]

17 January 2019
(update)

Slayer reward unlocks that apply to Konar quo Maten now correctly say so on the Slayer Unlock menu.

14 January 2019
(update) 		Hotfix

Konar's drop table was tweaked once again. Rune drops, yew logs, and crystal keys were entirely removed from the drop table. The weighting of pure essence was reduced from 5 to 1, making it a far less likely drop. Additionally, the Alchemical Hydra gained access to Konar's drop table. The Lizardman Shaman Caves for Konar Slayer tasks have been replaced with a Molch area. The caves are now covered by the Lizardmen Settlement area. [3]

11 January 2019
(update)

The average value of rolling Konar's drop table was reduced by 30%, removing several drops, whilst introducing pieces of the Mystic robes (dusk) set to the drop table.

10 January 2019
 Hotfix

An extremely rare drop of 2,500 Saradomin brews was removed from Konar's drop table shortly after release.[4]

  4. â†‘ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 January 2019. (Archived from the original on 29 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "It was there on launch, but it was removed shortly after. It was also extremely rare."

[[File:Konar quo Maten chathead.png|left]]
'''Konar quo Maten''' (translated as '''Konar the Hunter''') is a [[slayer master]] who is found in the [[Kahlith]] settlement on the summit of [[Mount Karuulm]]. Players must have a [[combat level]] of at least 75 to be assigned a [[Slayer task]] from her.

The quickest way to reach her is via [[Rada's blessing 3]] or [[Rada's blessing 4|4]]'s teleport, which would take the player right atop of [[Mount Karuulm]]. Players who haven't completed the [[Kourend & Kebos Diary#Hard|hard]] or [[Kourend & Kebos Diary#Elite|elite Kourend & Kebos Diaries]] can easily reach her by heading north of ''either'' the {{Fairycode|CIR}} [[Fairy rings|fairy ring]], the [[Farming Guild]] teleport (found on the [[Skills necklace]]/[[Farming cape]]) or the [[Battlefront Teleport|Battlefront teleport]].

Konar is initially unavailable in the [[NPC Contact]] spell and must be spoken to first, before becoming an option. The right-click "Assignment" option will '''not''' unlock her in NPC contact.

==Slayer points==
Players can receive [[slayer reward point]]s for completing [[Slayer task]]sâ€”this is based on how many tasks players have accomplished in a row. Completion of a task assigned by Konar will grant you a varying amount of points, depending if players have completed the [[Kourend & Kebos Diary]]. Although she is the third highest slayer master, she gives the second highest slayer point reward per task due to requiring players to slay in a specific area. This is only beaten by [[Krystilia]] who gives slayer tasks in the [[Wilderness]].

==Tasks==
Unlike other slayer masters, Konar's [[Slayer task]]s also include a specific location where you must complete the entire task. For example, if Konar assigns the player an [[Abyssal demon]] task, she will direct the player to slay them in either the [[Slayer Tower]], the [[Catacombs of Kourend]] '''or''' the [[Abyssal Area]] for the entire task. Bosses count towards task progression should the substitute be in the same area as the assigned monster (e.g if the player is assigned to kill [[Black demon|black demons]] in the [[Catacombs of Kourend]], killing [[Skotizo]] will count towards the task).

She will not send players to the Wilderness apart from boss slayer, as [[Krystilia]] is the one who specialises at this.

In return for killing the assigned monsters at the location Konar specifies, players have a chance of receiving a [[Brimstone key]], which can be used to open the [[Brimstone chest]] next to her.

Lastly, while the [[Slayer cape]] perk gives a 10% chance to be reassigned the same monster for a player's task, the location she asks you to slay them can be different from the last task.

Lizards have a slayer req of 22 with no combat req, so their sort value is 2200, with the 0s at the end to make sure it sorts correctly-->

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 28 February 2019
|update = QoL and CoX Changes
|change = 
*Konar will no longer assign Black, Red, Blue or Green dragons within the Kourend Catacombs if the player has under 100 combat
*Konar will no longer assign Fire giants in the Waterfall Dungeon to players who haven't yet completed the Waterfall Quest
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 7 February 2019
|update = X Marks The Spot
|poll = Old School Content Poll 63: Kebos - Post Launch Changes
|change = Loot from Konar's drop table are replaced by [[brimstone key]]s; the loot has now been moved to the [[brimstone chest]] which the key accesses.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 21 January 2019
|update = Revised Post Kebos Poll Blog
|type = hotfix
|change = Konar's drop table was re-tweaked, removing [[Adamant bolts(unf)|adamant]] and [[Runite bolts (unf)|runite bolts]] and reintroducing [[dragon dart tips]] and [[magic logs]], a bug resulting in noted drops being received in unnoted form was fixed.{{CiteTwitter|author=Old School RuneScape|url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/1087388290397794304|date=21 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/ypxJo|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote="A bug resulting certain drops not appearing noted as intended has been hotfixed."}}
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 17 January 2019
|update = Kebos Graphical Changes and Other Fixes
|change = Slayer reward unlocks that apply to Konar quo Maten now correctly say so on the Slayer Unlock menu.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 14 January 2019
|update = Konar Loot Table Balancing
|type = hotfix
|change = Konar's drop table was tweaked once again. Rune drops, [[yew logs]], and [[crystal keys]] were entirely removed from the drop table. The weighting of pure essence was reduced from 5 to 1, making it a far less likely drop. Additionally, the [[Alchemical Hydra]] gained access to Konar's drop table. The Lizardman Shaman Caves for Konar Slayer tasks have been replaced with a Molch area. The caves are now covered by the Lizardmen Settlement area.
{{CiteTwitter|author=Old School RuneScape|url=https://twitter.com/OldSchoolRS/status/1084834960543043585|date=14 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/Y6myp|archivedate=25 May 2020}}
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 11 January 2019
|update = Konar Loot Table Balancing
|change = The average value of rolling Konar's drop table was reduced by 30%, removing several drops, whilst introducing pieces of the [[Mystic robes#Dusk|Mystic robes (dusk)]] set to the drop table.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 10 January 2019
|type = hotfix
|change = An extremely rare drop of 2,500 [[Saradomin brew]]s was removed from Konar's drop table shortly after release.{{CiteTwitter|author=Mod Ash|url=https://twitter.com/JagexAsh/status/1083515413793783809|date=11 January 2019|archiveurl=https://archive.is/aRxlq|archivedate=29 May 2020|quote=It was there on launch, but it was removed shortly after. It was also extremely rare.}}
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}
